member.name: T:Gemmob.IPoolable
member.summary: inherit this interface to mark the game object is poolable, it mean the gameobject will be add to pooled when recycle, else it will be destroy.

member.name: M:Gemmob.IPoolable.OnSpawnCallback
member.summary:
This will be call automaticaly by "PoolManager.Spawn". Do not call this outside.
Init your variable inside here.

member.name: M:Gemmob.IPoolable.OnRecycleCallback
member.summary:
This will be call automaticaly by "PoolManager.Recycle". Do not call this outside.
Put your callback action inside here. This call before OnDisable

member.name: T:Gemmob.Poolable
member.summary: Base MonoBehavior with interface IPoolable

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolExtensions.IsRegistered(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: To check if gameobject has been registered with pool, no need to register again.

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolExtensions.HasPooled(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: To check if gameobject can be spawn from pool, no need to instantiate new gameobject.

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolExtensions.HasSpawned(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: To check if gameobject has been spawned (currently active in scene)

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolExtensions.RegisterPool``1(``0)
member.summary:
Call this to register gameobject with Pool, so the game object will be add to pooled when recycle, else it will be destroy.
If your scrip inhenrit from interface "IPoolable", you no longer need to call this method.

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolExtensions.RegisterPool``1(``0,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Call this to register gameobject with Pool, so the game object will be add to pooled when recycle, else it will be destroy.
If your scrip inhenrit from interface "IPoolable", you no longer need to call this method.

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolExtensions.RegisterPool(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary:
Call this to register gameobject with Pool, so the game object will be add to pooled when recycle, else it will be destroy.
If your scrip inhenrit from interface "IPoolable", you no longer need to call this method.

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolExtensions.RegisterPool(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Call this to register gameobject with Pool, so the game object will be add to pooled when recycle, else it will be destroy.
If your scrip inhenrit from interface "IPoolable", you no longer need to call this method.

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolExtensions.UnRegisterPool(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Destroy gameobject which is register with pool (include pooled and spawned)

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolExtensions.UnRegisterPool``1(``0)
member.summary: Destroy gameobject which is register with pool (include pooled and spawned)

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolExtensions.Spawn``1(``0,UnityEngine.Transform,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Quaternion)
member.summary:
Instantiate (clone) a game object from "prefab" object.
Source object is "IPoolable"
If "prefab" is inherit from interface "IPoolable", or was register by "CreatePool" before, output gameObject will be add into pooled list and can be reuse when recycle.

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolExtensions.Recycle``1(``0)
member.summary:
Remove game object from the scene (Disable or Destroy)
If game object is "IPoolable" (or was register by "RegisterPool"), it will be set to DISABLE, else it will be DESTROY

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolExtensions.Recycle(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary:
Remove game object from the scene (Disable or Destroy)
If game object is "IPoolable" (or was register by "RegisterPool"), it will be set to DISABLE, else it will be DESTROY

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolExtensions.RecycleAll``1(``0)
member.summary:
Remove game object from the scene (Disable or Destroy)
If game object is "IPoolable" (or was register by "RegisterPool"), it will be set to DISABLE, else it will be DESTROY

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolExtensions.RecycleAll(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary:
Remove game object from the scene (Disable or Destroy)
If game object is "IPoolable" (or was register by "RegisterPool"), it will be set to DISABLE, else it will be DESTROY

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolManager.RegisterPool(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Call this to register gameobject with Pool, so the game object will be add to pooled when recycle, else it will be destroy.
If your scrip inhenrit from interface "IPoolable", you no longer need to call this method.

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolManager.IsRegistered(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: To check if gameobject has been registered with pool, no need to register again.

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolManager.HasPooled(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: To check if gameobject can be spawn from pool, no need to instantiate new gameobject.

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolManager.HasSpawned(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: To check if gameobject has been spawned (currently active in scene)

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolManager.UnRegisterPool(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Destroy gameobject which is register with pool (include pooled and spawned)

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolManager.UnRegisterPool``1(``0)
member.summary: Destroy gameobject which is register with pool (include pooled and spawned)

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolManager.DestroyPooled(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary:
Destroy all gameobject which is currently in pooled (currently disable in scene)
No action with spawned (currently active in scene)

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolManager.DestroyPooled``1(``0)
member.summary:
Destroy all gameobject which is currently in pooled (currently disable in scene)
No action with spawned (currently active in scene)

member.name: M:Gemmob.PoolManager.DestroyAll
member.summary: Destroy all gameobject which is managing by PoolManager, include all spawned and pooled.
